data.text:
Production Information

Studio: Columbia

Short Number: 51

Release Date: November 15, 1940

Running Time: 17.5

“Yeah, we know. 1410 South American Way. No cover charge anytime. Glad to meet me.”

(Curly, Larry and Moe)

Short Take

The Stooges sell fish and are getting nowhere, so they quit for another business… running a bar. Falling to the charm of a shady real estate man (“You give me the money, I give you the business”), they buy a saloon in Mexico only to learn they’re now the owners of a beauty salon. Making the best of the situation, the Stooges have nothing to lose and become beauticians. Their first customers are four beautiful local girls. Yes, beautiful. But, for how long?

Cast & Crew

Credited Production Crew:

Produced & Directed by Jules White

Story & Screenplay by Ewart Adamson

Director of Photography Henry Freulich

Film Editor Arther Seid

Credited Cast:

Curly Howard

Larry Fine

Moe Howard

Uncredited Cast:

Lynton Brent – Pedro Ruiz

Dorothy Appleby – Rosita

Bob O’Connor – Manuel Gonzalez

Blanche Payson – fish customer in window

Anita Garvin

Trivia

On their fish truck in Cookoo Cavaliers, we see Hook, Line & Sinker. Match up the first names to these. (A: Larry Hook – Moe Line – Curly Sinker)

Production Notes
